tit.e: Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street)
Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street)
Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street)

sen.j: 御薗橋801商店街（みそのばしはちまるいちしょうてんがい）は京都市北区御薗橋西詰から西へ800mの長さに渡って続く京都市最北の商店街である。
sen.e: Located in the northernmost place of Kyoto, Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street) is a shopping street whose length is 800 m to the west from Misonobashi-nishizume (the west end of Misono-bashi Bridge), Kita Ward, Kyoto City

Located in the northernmost place in Kyoto, Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street) it's length is 800 m to the west from Misonobashi-nishizume (the west end of Misono-bashi Bridge), Kita Ward, Kyoto City

Located in the northernmost place in Kyoto, Misonobashi Hachimaruichi Shotengai (the Misonobashi 801 shopping street) it's length is 800m to the west from Misonobashi-nishizume (the west end of Misono-bashi Bridge), Kita Ward, Kyoto City
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 商店街名は全長の800に未来への発展を意味して1を加えたもの。
sen.e: The name of the shopping street comes from its length of 800 m plus 1 which was added intending a further expansion in the future.
The name of the shopping street comes from its length of 800 m plus 1 which was added intending further expansion in the future.
The name of the shopping street comes from its length of 800m plus 1 which was added intending further expansion in the future.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 周囲には京都産業大学や世界文化遺産である上賀茂神社、西賀茂、神光院、賀茂川などがある。
sen.e: Around there, Kyoto Sangyo University, Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, a world heritage property, Nishigamo, Jinko-in Temple and Kamo-gawa River exist
Nearby are the, Kyoto Sangyo University, Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, a world heritage property, Nishigamo, Jinko-in Temple and Kamo-gawa Rivert
Nearby are the, Kyoto Sangyo University, Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, a world heritage property, Nishigamo, Jinko-in Temple and Kamo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: Riverスペル訂正しました。ピリオド補足。余分なスペース削除しました。

sen.j: 京都精華大学の学生によって京野菜のナスをイメージしてデザインされた同商店街のマスコット「801ちゃん」は女性向けの男性同性愛を扱った作品を意味する「やおい」と掛けた二次創作漫画『となりの801ちゃん』がヒットして今や同作品は商店街の公認を受けている。
sen.e: "801-chan (pronounced as Yaoichi-chan)," the mascot designed for the shopping street by students of Kyoto Seika University imaging a Kyoto-specific eggplant, has now been made offical by the street, because "Tonari no 801 (Yaoi)-chan," a spin-out manga (cartoon) in which "Yaoi"is also used for suggesting "Yaoi"meaning a male-homosexual-love-dealing product for feamales, has become very popular.

"801-chan (pronounced as Yaoichi-chan)," the mascot designed for the shopping street by students of Kyoto Seika University imaging a Kyoto-specific eggplant, has now been made offical by the street, because "Tonari no 801 (Yaoi)-chan," a spin-off manga (cartoon) in which "Yaoi"is also used for suggesting "Yaoi"meaning a male-homosexual-love-dealing product for females, has become very popular.

801-chan (pronounced as Yaoichi-chan),' the mascot designed for the shopping street by students of Kyoto Seika University imaging a Kyoto-specific eggplant, has now been made official by the street, because "Tonari no 801 (Yaoi)-chan," a spin-off manga (cartoon) in which 'Yaoi' is also used for suggesting 'Yaoi' meaning a male-homosexual-love-dealing product for females, has become very popular.
sen.cmt: officialスペル訂正しました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。”を"に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。
